Company: South Eastern Melbourne Primary Health Network
Ad Text:
About the role

As the Intelligence Automation Specialist, you will design and implement system-supported workflows and intelligent automation that improve efficiency, consistency, and scalability. You will translate governed business processes into reliable, explainable automation using low-code, rule-based, and selective AI-assisted approaches—ensuring strong controls, transparency, and human oversight.

Key responsibilities

Analyse end-to-end processes and identify automation opportunities

Design and implement workflows using low-code and rule-based platforms (e.g. Power Platform)

Build logic for validation, approvals, task routing, notifications, and exception handling

Configure event-driven, agent-assisted, and RPA solutions where appropriate

Ensure automation aligns with governance, privacy, security, and SOPs

Maintain documentation, version control, and change management

Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimise automation performance

Collaborate with Business Analysts, system support, governance, and IT teams


About you

Essential

Qualification in IT, Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience

Strong experience delivering workflow automation or low-code solutions

Ability to translate business rules into executable logic

Experience with validation, approvals, routing, and exception handling

Experience working across multiple systems in regulated environments

Strong documentation and communication skills

Experience with Microsoft Power Platform (e.g. Power Automate) or similar tools

Desirable

RPA or intelligent automation experience

Exposure to AI-assisted decision support in governed environments

Experience in health, government, or compliance-heavy sectors


Why You’ll Love It Here

Boost Your Take-Home Pay: Access generous salary packaging options

Flexible Work, Real Balance: Hybrid working that supports life outside work

Parental Leave That Cares: 10 weeks of paid parental leave

Extra Leave for You: Leave loading and dedicated festive leave

Support When It Matters: 5 additional paid carers leave days

Wellbeing First: Free, confidential EAP support for you and your family

Values-Led Culture: Purpose-driven, people-focused and genuinely collaborative

Health & Wellness: Access annual health programs, vaccinations and wellbeing initiatives

Grow With Us: Ongoing learning, development and career progression opportunities

Closing Date: 16 February 2026

Click Apply Now with a copy of your CV and cover letter to start your next chapter!
